Judul: PREDICTING WELL CUMULATIVE OIL RECOVERY IN VERY TIGHT AND HYDRAULICALLY FRACTURED SANDSTONE USING MULTIVARIATE REGRESSION AND ARTIFICIAL INTELLEGENCE APPROACH
Abstrak:
Economic feasibility in reservoir development effort need estimate revenue to be generated from the investments, such decision of workover or infill drilling. Hence, the success in reservoir development in terms of economics depends on the prediction accuracy of the total reserves that can be recovered from the well.  
 

The cumulative recovery prediction could be achieved by many approaches, such as reservoir simulation, analogy to the adjacent well using DCA, volumetric calculation and its recovery factor, or material balance. Each approach has its advantages and disadvantages, such as reservoir simulation has better accuracy but high cost and time consuming in history matching, or adjacent well DCA has more simple in calculation but less accuracy due to many assumption involved in the calculation, may risked in getting a non-confidence results.  
 

This study focuses on development of a framework by applying multivariate nonlinear regression and adaptive neuro-fuzzy inference system (ANFIS) to predict cumulative recovery of well in TLS formation in Y field. Furthermore, the predictive model can be generalized to determine optimum well placement, optimum fracturing design and assessing economic feasibility of workover of infill drilling in the future work. In this modeling, the input data were coordinates of TLS reservoir and hydraulic fracture parameters (x,y) and the output data was the cumulative oil recovery for TLS well. Both in ANFIS and Multivariate, training involves iterative adjustment for mapping each training vector to its output target vector with minimum of normalized root squared error. As validation, the performance of the model is assessed / validated to real checking data, using coefficient of determination and normalised root mean squared error (NRMSE) as statistical tools to measure accuracy between predictive and observed data.  
 

The statistical parameter values of coefficient of determination (R2) for ANFIS and Multivariate prediction were obtained to be 0.92 and 0.25 and the NRMSE to be 4% and 28% respectively. ANFIS can be an alternative method to predict well cumulative oil production in very tight sandstone formation that has been hydraulically fractured since the validation of the predicted data showing good result. The most contributive parameter that affect cumulative production of hydraulically fractured tight sandstone wells, based on ANFIS model for TLS Y field is fracturing half length.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Pembimbing : Dr. Ir. Sudjati Rachmat, DEA
Kata Kunci: Economic feasibility, reservoir development, The cumulative recovery, Kelayakan ekonomi,
